name: uncheckable
content:
uncheckable adjective
(INFORMATION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If information is uncheckable, it is impossible to check whether it is correct: The reports rely upon uncheckable word-of-mouth reminiscences.
More examplesFewer examplesThe problem with most of these comments was that they were off the record, uncheckable, and often defamatory. The rumours started with a photo, an unfounded assertion, and an uncheckable fact.They are dependent upon unreliable and usually uncheckable sources.

uncheckable adjective
(POWER)
Uncheckable power or an uncheckable activity cannot be limited or prevented from continuing: The panel has virtually uncheckable power to put through its changes. The practice continues, uncheckable, and no-one has the courage to point out how harmful it can be. See also
unchecked
More examplesFewer examplesThe court rejected the president's assertion of uncheckable authority.Unbeaten for three-and-a-half months, he was on a roll that had started to look uncheckable.
